filesystem

Class Directory

  • java.lang.Object
    • filesystem.DiskItem
      • filesystem.Directory

  • public class Directory
extends DiskItem
    A class of directories.
    Version:
    2.3 - 2018
    Author:
    Tommy Messelis
    Invariant:
    Each directory must have proper items registered in it.
        hasProperItems()

    • Field Detail

      • items

        private final List<DiskItem> items
        Variable referencing a list collecting all items contained by this directory. The class DiskItem is responsible for controlling the bidirectional relationship. Files and directories can only be added or deleted through the constructors/destructors of File and Directory and through the move and makeRoot methods, hence the protected methods for adding and removing items from the directory
        Invariants:
      • items references an effective list.
            items != null
      • Each element in the list references an effective item.
            for each item in items:
              item != null
      • Each element in the list references a non-terminated item.
            for each item in items:
            !item.isTerminated()
      • Each element in the list (except the first element) references an item that has a name which (ignoring case) comes after the name of the immediately preceding element, in lexicographic order.
            for each I in 1..items.size() - 1:
              items.get(I).isOrderedAfter(items.get(I-1))
      • Each element in the list references an item that references back to this directory.
            for each item in items:
              item.getParentDirectory() == this

    • Constructor Detail

      • Directory

        public Directory(String name,
                 boolean writable)
        Initialize a new root directory with given name and writability.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new directory.
        writable - The writability of the new directory.
        Postcondition:
        The new directory has no items.
            new.getNbItems() == 0
        Effect:
        The new directory is a disk item with the given name and writability.
            super(name,writable)

      • Directory

        public Directory(String name)
        Initialize a new writable root directory with given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new directory.
        Effect:
        The new root directory is initialized with the given name and is writable.
            this(name,true)

      • Directory

        public Directory(Directory parent,
                 String name,
                 boolean writable)
          throws IllegalArgumentException,
                 DiskItemNotWritableException
        Initialize a new directory with given parent directory, name and writability.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent directory of the new directory.
        name - The name of the new directory.
        writable - The writability of the new directory.
        Postcondition:
        The new directory has no items.
            new.getNbItems() == 0
        Effect:
        The new directory is a disk item with the given parent, name and writability.
            super(parent,name,writable)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException
        DiskItemNotWritableException

    • Method Detail

      • canBeTerminated

        public boolean canBeTerminated()
        Check whether this directory can be terminated.
        Overrides:
        canBeTerminated in class DiskItem
        Returns:
        True if the directory is not yet terminated, is writable, contains 0 items and it is either a root or its parent directory is writable
            result == getNbItems() == 0 && !isTerminated() && isWritable()
                       && (isRoot() || getParentDirectory().isWritable())
        Note:
        We have added a condition to the open specs of the superclass. Now the specification is in closed form.

      • getNbItems

        @Basic
 @Raw
public int getNbItems()
        Return the number of items of this directory.

      • getItemAt

        @Basic
 @Raw
public DiskItem getItemAt(int index)
                                throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Return the item registered at the given position in this directory.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the item to be returned.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - The given index is not strictly positive or exceeds the number of items registered in this directory. | (index < 1) || (index > getNbItems())
        IndexOutOfBoundsException

      • hasAsItem

        @Raw
public boolean hasAsItem(@Raw
                              DiskItem item)
        Check whether the given item is registered in this directory.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if an item equal to the given item is registered at some position in this directory; false otherwise.
            result ==
               for some I in 1..getNbItems() :
                   (getItemAt(I) == item)

      • hasProperItems

        @Raw
public boolean hasProperItems()
        Check whether this directory has valid items.
        Returns:
        True if and only if this directory can have all its items at their respective indices
            result ==
              for each I in 1..getNbItems() :
                canHaveAsItemAt(getItemAt(I),I) && getItemAt(I).getParentDirectory() == this
        Note:
        This checker ensures the consistency of the bidirectional relationship and calls another checker to check all other requirements (except this consistency)

      • canHaveAsItemAt

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsItemAt(@Raw
                                    DiskItem item,
                                    int index)
        Check whether this directory can have the given item at the given index.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be checked.
        index - The index to be checked.
        Returns:
        False if this directory cannot have the given item at any index otherwise, false if the given index is not positive or exceeds the number of items with more than one otherwise, if the item is in this directory then true if and only if it is ordered after its predecessor and before it successor (if those exist) else true if and only if inserting the item at the given index would not result in an unordered sequence
            if (!canHaveAsItem(item)) then result == false
            else if (index < 1 || index > getNbItems() +1) then result == false
                else if (hasAsItem(item))
             then result == (index == 1 || getItemAt(index-1).isOrderedBefore(item))
             && (index == getNbItems() || getItemAt(index+1).isOrderedAfter(item))
             else result == (index == 1 || getItemAt(index-1).isOrderedBefore(item))
             && (index == getNbItems() + 1 || getItemAt(index).isOrderedAfter(item))
        Note:
        This checker checks all conditions, except the consistency of the bidirectional relationship. It can be used to verify existing items in this directory, as well as to verify whether a new item can be added at a certain position.

      • canHaveAsItem

        @Raw
public boolean canHaveAsItem(@Raw
                                  DiskItem item)
        Check whether this directory can have the given item as one of its items.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be checked.
        Returns:
        If the given item is not effective or if it is terminated or if this directory is terminated, then false, else if the given item is the same as this directory then false else if the given item is a direct or indirect parent of this directory then false else if the given item is an item of this directory then true if and only if the given item has a unique name in this directory else true if and only if the name of the given item does not yet exist in this directory and the given item is a root item or the parent directory of the given item is writable
            if (item == null || item.isTerminated() || this.isTerminated())
            then result == false
            else if (item == this) then result == false
                else if (item.isDirectOrIndirectParentOf(this)) then false
             else if (this.hasAsItem(item))
              then result == for one I in 1..getNbItems:
                  item.getName().equalsIgnoreCase(getItemAt(I).getName())
              else result == (!this.containsDiskItemWithName(item.getName()) &&
             (item.isRoot() || item.getParentDirectory().isWritable()))
        Note:
        This checker does not verify the consistency of the bidirectional relationship.

      • addAsItem

        @Model
protected void addAsItem(@Raw
                                DiskItem item)
                         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Add the given item to the items registered in this directory.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be added.
        Postconditions:
      • The number of items registered in this directory is incremented with 1.
            new.getNbItems() == getNbItems() + 1
      • The given item is added to the items registered in this directory.
            new.hasAsItem(item)
      • All items registered in this directory, that are ordered after the given item are shifted one position to the right.
            for each I in 1..getNbItems():
              if (getItemAt(I).isOrderedAfter(item))
                then new.getItemAt(I+1) == getItemAt(I)
        • Effect:
        The new modification time of this directory is updated.
            setModificationTime()
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - The item already exists in this directory or it can not have the given item as item. | hasAsItem(item) || !canHaveAsItem(item)

      • addItemAt

        private void addItemAt(@Raw
                       DiskItem item,
                       int index)
                throws IllegalArgumentException
        Insert the given item at the given index.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be added.
        index - The index where the given item must be inserted.
        Postconditions:
      • The number of items registered in this directory is incremented with 1.
            new.getNbItems() == getNbItems() + 1
      • The given item is inserted at the given index.
            new.getItemAt(index) == item
      • All items after the given index are shifted one position to the right.
            for each I in index..getNbItems():
              new.getItemAt(I+1) == getItemAt(I)
        • Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - This directory already contains the given item or cannot have it at the given index. | hasAsItem(item) || !canHaveAsItemAt(item,index)

      • removeAsItem

        @Raw
 @Model
protected void removeAsItem(@Raw
                                         DiskItem item)
                                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        Remove the given item from this directory.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to remove
        Effects:
      • If the item was in this directory, it is removed at the position it was registered
            if (hasAsItem(item) then removeItemAt(getIndexOf(item))
      • The new modification time of this directory is updated.
            setModificationTime()
        • Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - The given item is not in the directory | ! hasAsItem(item)

      • removeItemAt

        @Raw
 @Model
private void removeItemAt(int index)
                                throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Remove the given item at the given index from this directory.
        Parameters:
        index - The index from the item to remove.
        Postconditions:
      • This directory no longer has the item at the given index as an item
            !new.hasAsItem(getItemAt(index))
      • All elements to the right of the removed item are shifted left by 1 position.
            for each I in index+1..getNbItems():
              new.getItemAt(I-1) == getItemAt(I)
      • The number of items has decreased by one
            new.getNbItems() == getNbItems() - 1
        • Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - The given position is not positive or exceeds the number of items registered in this directory. | (index < 1) || (index > getNbItems())

      • isDirectOrIndirectSubdirectoryOf

        public boolean isDirectOrIndirectSubdirectoryOf(Directory other)
                                         throws IllegalArgumentException
        Check whether this directory is a direct or indirect subdirectory of the given other directory
        Parameters:
        other - The directory to check with.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the other directory is a direct or indirect parent of this directory
            result == other.isDirectOrIndirectParentOf(this)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - The given other directory is not effective. | other == null

      • containsDiskItemWithName

        @Raw
public boolean containsDiskItemWithName(String name)
        Check whether this directory contains an item with the given name
        Parameters:
        name - The name to check.
        Returns:
        True if an item with the given name (ignoring case) is registered at some position in this directory; false otherwise.
            result ==
              (for some I in 1..getNbItems():
                 getItemAt(I).getName().equalsIgnoreCase(name))

      • exists

        public boolean exists(String name)
        Check whether this directory contains an item with the given name
        Parameters:
        name - The name to check.
        Returns:
        True if an item with the given name (ignoring case) is registered in this directory; false otherwise.
            result == containsDiskItemWithName(name)

      • getItem

        public DiskItem getItem(String name)
        Return the item in this directory with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the item to be looked up.
        Returns:
        the item in this directory with the given name, if such an item exists null otherwise
            if (containsDiskItemWithName(name))
            then (hasAsItem(result) &&
             result.getName().equalsIgnoreCase(name))
            else result == null
        Note:
        This operation should complete in O(log(n)) time

      • getIndexOf

        public int getIndexOf(@Raw
                      DiskItem item)
               throws IllegalArgumentException
        Return the position at which the given item is registered.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be searched.
        Returns:
        The given item is registered in this directory at the resulting position.
            getItemAt(result)==item
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - The given item is not in the directory | ! hasAsItem(item)

      • restoreOrderAfterNameChangeAt

        @Raw
 @Model
protected void restoreOrderAfterNameChangeAt(int index)
        Restore the order of the items in this directory, given only one of them may be in the wrong position due to a name change
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the item with a new name
        Postconditions:
      • this directory has proper items
            hasProperItems()
      • The index of a certain number of items has changed
            for each I in 1..getNbItems() :
              for some J in 1..getNbItems() :
                 new.getItemAt(J) == getItemAt(I)
        • Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - The given index is not valid | (index < 1) || (index > getNbItems())
